Package javelin.model.world.location.dungeon

Class Wilderness

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.Dungeon
          • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.Wilderness
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Wilderness
extends Dungeon
    A type of Location that plays like a Dungeon but is instead meant to be more relaxed and exploration-focused than anything. Maps are bigger and based on Fight maps instead. Encounters are always Difficulty.EASY. As far as fight()s go, we assume that each encounter wll take 10% of a Squad's resources. Also that it will take around 1d4 attemps to fully explore the area. Chests here will be largely for show only, since the area itself has little challenge that isn't rewarded per-se. Other features however, are fully operational which can either give decent boons (like a LearningStone) or an even unfairer advantage in exploring the area. TODO could Hazards be used here instead of a fight() some of the time? TODO a cool Feature would be "boss" encouners, probably signified by a skull. could also have a RareTable for Dungeons and other for Wilderness, with a small change of taking from the other instead, giving each more personality. Common would be common to both. TODO could have town quests place trinkets to be retrieved from wildernessesn
